intro: Jussiaea dodecandra, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators.
